commitResults.messageTitle: Implement skeletal version that greets and exits
Add echo feature to skeletal version
Add basic task list commands BYE, ADD and LIST
commitResults.messageBody:
Replaced recursive input handling with a while loop and command types to
support ADD and LIST, and exit on BYE.

A loop-based structure scales better for an interactive chatbot and
makes it easier to add more commands.

Provides support for marking tasks as done and unmarking them back to
not done.

This adds basic task status management for future task operations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for todo, deadline and event tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduced ToDoTask, DeadlineTask and EventTask to represent different
task types and display their details in the task list.

This lays the groundwork for type-specific operations in the future,
such as filtering tasks based on their type.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor input handling and output formatting
commitResults.messageBody:
Move command handling into helper methods to keep handleInput concise.

Adjust minor newline formatting for consistent text UI output.

Implement DELETE to remove a task by its list index and update the task
count shown to the user.

This enables basic task management beyond adding and marking tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle invalid task input with custom exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add InvalidCommandFormatException for invalid command arguments
- Validate todo/deadline/event input formats before task creation
- Enforce non-empty task descriptions and deadline/event timing fields

commitResults.messageTitle: Adjust code to follow coding standards

commitResults.messageBody:
- Validate task index bounds for mark/unmark/delete
- Throw InvalidCommandInputException on invalid indices

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract code into ui, storage, parser and command classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Move user interaction to Ui
- Add Storage for loading/saving tasks
- Add Parser for command parsing
- Introduce Command classes

This improves maintainability and makes future features easier to implement.

- Create data folder/file automatically if missing
- Serialise tasks using the save format (T/D/E | done | desc | time)
- Add custom file I/O exceptions: FileLoadException, WriteFileException, CreateFileException
Add DateTimeFormatter patterns for dd/MM/yyyy HHmm date-time formats

commitResults.messageTitle: Add find command to search tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Implement task searching by keyword and display all matching results

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for TaskList getTask and DeadlineTask constructor
Remove kaomoji faces and fix typos
Adjust code to match coding standard
Fix style and change scroll bar colour
Document internal assumptions using Java assertions
commitResults.messageBody:
Some assumptions in the code are not written down and are only noticed
when a runtime bug occurs.

This makes it harder to tell whether a problem is caused by a bug in the
code or by an unexpected program state.

Let's use Java assertions to clearly document important internal
assumptions, such as object initialisation and parsing contracts.

Assertions are used only for programmer-controlled conditions, while
user input errors are still handled using exceptions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor task handling and clean up method documentation
commitResults.messageBody:
Some task-related logic was duplicated across methods.
In addition, some overridden methods repeated Javadoc that was already
documented in their parent classes, adding unnecessary duplication.

Let's refactor task handling to centralize shared logic, update Javadoc
to clearly document public method contracts where needed, and remove
redundant documentation from overridden methods.

This improves readability and maintainability by reducing duplication and
keeping documentation focused on meaningful behavior.
Document internal assumptions using Java assertions
Refactor task handling and clean up method documentation
